GMTOOLKIT.Message.UnexpectedNoChange: Something unexpected happened. No change has been made.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.menu.name: Advantage Handling
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.menu.label: Configure Advantage Handling
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.menu.hint: Set options for automated, assisted and macro-based advantage handling.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.menu.title: Advantage Handling
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.PersistNoti: Advantage related notices are left onscreen until manually dismissed. By default, Foundry will only show three notifications onscreen at once, so newer messages may not be seen until these are removed.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.Automate.Op: Increase Advantage for the character who wins an opposed test in an active combat. Clear Advantage from losing tokens. This is triggered when the defender rolls.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.Automate.Un: Increase Advantage for the character who deals damage from an unopposed test. Clear Advantage from tokens who take Wounds. This is triggered when choosing an Apply Damage option from a test result card in chat.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.Automate.Su: Automatically clear Advantage when a character gains a new Condition during combat.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.Automate.Lo: Prompt at the end of each round to select combatants that have not accrued Advantage in the round, and to reduce their Advantage by 1.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Advantage.Automate.Co: Clear Advantage from tokens when they are added to the combat tracker, not when a blank encounter is created or combat is begun.
Clear Advantage from tokens when they are removed from the combat tracker, rather than when combat is ended.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.TokenHudExtensions.En: Make tooltips and interactions for key attributes and skills available from the hud of controlled tokens. Enabled by default.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.TokenHudExtensions.Al: Always Show Initiative in Token Hud Extension
If disabled, Initiative and Agility tooltips and shortcuts are only available in active scenes. Enabled by default.
GMTOOLKIT.TokenHudExtension.LittlePrayer: {actorName} offered a Little Prayer to the Gods ({littlePrayerResult}).
GMTOOLKIT.TokenHudExtension.ImportTable: {table} table not found. Please import from the Compendium.
GMTOOLKIT.Token.Select: Please select one or more tokens first.
GMTOOLKIT.Token.SingleSelect: Please select a single token first.
GMTOOLKIT.Token.TargetPCs: Please target one or more PC tokens first.
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.SetVisionLight.Title: Set Token Vision and Light
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Vision.menu.name: Token Vision Settings
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Vision.menu.label: Configure Token Vision Settings
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Vision.menu.hint: Set default options for token vision to be used by the Set Token Vision and Light macro.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Vision.menu.title: Token Vision Settings
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Vision.NormalSight.hi: Maximum distance (yards) that a token without enhanced vision can see without an external light source in night or dim conditions.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Vision.DarkVision.hin: Maximum distance (yards) that a token with the Dark Vision Trait can see without an external light source in night or dim conditions. Applied to token DimSight (and halved for BrightSight)
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Vision.OverrideNightV: Apply Night Vision settings even if token does not have the Talent or Trait.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.Vision.OverrideDarkVi: Apply Dark Vision settings even if token does not have the Trait.
GMTOOLKIT.ResetFortune.NoPlayerCharacter: There are no player characters to restore Fortune for.
GMTOOLKIT.Advantage.Max: {actorName} already has {startingAdvantage} of maximum {maxAdvantage} Advantage. No change made.
GMTOOLKIT.Advantage.None: {actorName} already has {startingAdvantage} Advantage. No change made.
GMTOOLKIT.Advantage.Automation.Outmanoeu: {attackerName} outmanoeuvred {actorName}, inflicting {totalWoundLoss} Wounds. Stand by for Advantage update.
GMTOOLKIT.Advantage.Automation.OpposedTe: {winner} won a test against {loser}. Stand by for Advantage update.
GMTOOLKIT.Advantage.Automation.Condition: {character} is {condition}. Stand by for Advantage update.
GMTOOLKIT.Advantage.NotInCombat: {actorName} is not in an active encounter in scene {sceneName}. No change to Advantage is being made.
GMTOOLKIT.Message.Advantage.NoCombatants: No combatant who has Advantage has stalled.
GMTOOLKIT.Message.Advantage.LostMomentum: Advantage Reduced at End of Round {combatRound}
GMTOOLKIT.Message.Advantage.NoCombatants: No combatant has Advantage to lose in round {combatRound}.
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.Advantage.NotGainedAdva: Has not accrued Advantage this Round
Lose momentum at end of Round {combatRound}
GMTOOLKIT.Scene.TokenNotUnrestricted: Token Vision is enabled and Unrestricted Vision Range is disabled in scene {sceneName}.
GMTOOLKIT.Scene.UnrestrictedNotToken: Token Vision is disabled and Unrestricted Vision Range is enabled in scene {sceneName}.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.ScenePullActivate.hin: Activate the currently viewed scene when pulling everyone to it.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.ScenePullActivate.Nev: Never also activate scene (default module behaviour)
GMTOOLKIT.Message.ScenePullActivate.NoPe: Only GMs can pull players to scenes!
GMTOOLKIT.Message.ScenePullActivate.Pull: Characters have been pulled to {sceneName}. Scene is {sceneActiveState}.
GMTOOLKIT.Message.ScenePullActivate.Acti: Characters have been pulled to {sceneName} and scene has been activated.
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.ScenePullActivate.Title: Pull Everyone to Scene
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.ScenePullActivate.Promp: Do you want to activate the scene also?
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.AddXP.Prompt.name: Prompt for XP amount
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.AddXP.Prompt.hint: Always ask how many XP to add and reason for award. Otherwise use default amount and reason.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.AddXP.Default.name: Default XP Award
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.AddXP.Default.hint: Default amount of XP to award using the Add XP or End of Session Routine macro.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.AddXP.Reason.name: Default XP Reason
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.AddXP.Reason.hint: Default reason for awarding experience, recorded in the Experience Log on the Notes tab of character sheet). Use %date% or %session% to automatically include the session date or reference.
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.AddXP.Title: Add Experience Points
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.AddXP.InvalidXP: No change made. Add a valid number of XP. Fractions will be rounded to the nearest whole number. Negative numbers will be removed from the character's total.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.SessionManagement.men: Set scene management, experience handling and session turnover options.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.SessionEnd.ExportChat: Prompt to save the chat log when running the Session Turnover routine.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.SessionTurnover.Sessi: Replaces %session% variable in Add XP default reason. Whole numbers are automatically incremented when running the Session Turnover routine. Alternatively, manually set a more descriptive phrase (eg, "Episode 2.3", "Ritual Climax", etc).
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.SessionTurnover.Holdi: Name of scene to automatically transition to between sessions. Activated through Session Turnover routine. Leave blank to not change scenes. Can be used for landing pages and campaign hubs.
GMTOOLKIT.Message.SessionEnd.NoPermissio: Only GMs can administer end of session rites!
Test against the related characteristic if a character doesn't have the right Advanced Skill. Basic skill tests always fallback.
GMTOOLKIT.Message.MakeSecretPartyTest.No: Only GMs can make secret party tests!
GMTOOLKIT.Message.MakeSecretPartyTest.Ab: {character} does not have {skill}. Aborting advanced skill test.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.DarkWhispers.menu.hin: Set default options for Send Dark Whispers macro.
GMTOOLKIT.Settings.DarkWhispers.Filter.h: Set the default filter to select characters to receive a Dark Whisper. Override this by setting a parameter in the macro for 'all', 'present' or 'absent' party members.
GMTOOLKIT.Message.DarkWhispers.NoPermiss: Only GMs can send Dark Whispers!
GMTOOLKIT.Message.DarkWhispers.NoEligibl: No available characters have Corruption to exchange for a Dark Whisper.
GMTOOLKIT.Message.DarkWhispers.WhisperAb: So, Dark Whispers will not be heard at this time. Be silent for now, but do not call upon Dark Gods lightly, {currentUser}.
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.DarkWhispers.Title: Dark Whispers
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.DarkWhispers.WhisperTar: Who have the Dark Gods chosen?
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.DarkWhispers.NoCorrupti: No Corruption to spend on offer.
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.DarkWhispers.ImportTabl: Import the Dark Whispers RollTable from the GM Toolkit compendium to see Dark Whisper prompts here.
GMTOOLKIT.Message.DarkWhispers.Rejected: {currentUser} spurns the offer of the Dark Gods.
Choose the tone of Dark Whisper to suit your game.

The Dark Gods can see you are troubled.

For a discrete favour they can unburden you of 1 Corruption.

{message}

What harm can it do? Take the offer and step back from the brink of Chaos.

Dark Whispers Linger In Your Ears ...

Do not in any way reveal that you have received this message.

{message}

If you do as directed, your Corruption total will be reduced by 1.
GMTOOLKIT.Notification.NoActor: No Character is selected or associated with {currentuser}.
GMTOOLKIT.Dialog.GMToolbox.Title: GM Toolbox
